intro: Herpestis dubia, commonly known as the narrowleaf sandwort, is a flowering plant native to arid and semi-arid regions of North America. It is a member of the family Caryophyllaceae, which includes many flowering plants with showy blooms. The plant typically grows in sandy or gravelly soils and is adapted to withstand drought conditions. Its small, white or pink flowers appear in clusters and bloom in late spring to early summer. Herpestis dubia is often found in disturbed areas and has a low-growing, spreading habit.
